This has drawn a lot of criticism,<br>e.g.<br>http://www.insidehousing.co.uk/housing-figures-slam-dclg-plan-to-publish-data-less-frequently/7007915.article<br><br>Given that the EHS is one of relatively few good sources of data on<br>housing, and particularly for private sector housing, it's something I'll<br>be sending in a response to. [...] Tom Moore 2014-12-05T23:28:58+00:00 2014-12-05T23:28:58+00:00 CFP: Generation Rent Seminar - Young People\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Housing Options and Future Welfare https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;9bceba76.1412 With apologies for cross-posting, list members may be interested in either<br>attending or presenting at this seminar.The deadline for abstracts is<br>approaching - please note the revised deadline of *Wednesday 17th December.*<br>We welcome a range of disciplinary perspectives on the broad theme of young<br>people's housing options and future welfare.<br><br>*CFP: Deconstructing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGeneration Rent\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: Young People\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Housing Options and<br>Future Welfare* [...] Kat Clayton 2014-12-04T16:11:50+00:00 2014-12-04T16:11:50+00:00 Fwd: Right to Rent Checks https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;1beba675.1412 Hi all<br><br>This might be of interest to the list. Please direct any questions to<br>Saira.<br><br>Thanks<br><br>Kat<br><br>Dear All<br><br>As you will be aware MAX has been working on independently evaluating the<br>Right to Rent checks which are being piloted in the West Midlands. The<br>pilot started on Monday 1st December. To this end we are conducting a<br>survey of landlords and tenants. We are delighted that apart from the MAX<br>coalition we have worked with partner organisations to design the contents<br>of the questionnaires namely, Shelter, NUS and the Chartered Institute of<br>Housing. We have also been strongly [...] Kat Clayton 2014-11-28T15:44:18+00:00 2014-11-28T15:44:18+00:00 New briefing from the Race Equality Foundation: Ethnicity, health and the private rented sector https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;a29e98f1.1411 *apologies if you receive this more that once- please forward on to<br>interested parties*<br><br>Ethnicity, health and the private rented sector<br>http://www.better-housing.org.uk/briefings/ethnicity-health-and-private-rented-sector<br>The link between poor housing and poor health is well documented and<br>extremely complex, with numerous confounding factors having direct and<br>indirect impacts on both physical and mental health. Evidence shows that<br>homes in the private rented sector in England are in poorer physical<br>condition compared to owner-occupied or social rented sector homes, whilst<br>the recession has led to rising levels of insecurity within the sector,<br>which may also have an impact on the health of residents. While [...] Kat Clayton 2014-11-24T17:33:01+00:00 2014-11-24T17:33:01+00:00 Fwd: Stop thousands of evictions https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;6780613f.1411 ---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: Geoff - Shelter <hello@email.shelter.org.uk><br>Date: 24 November 2014 at 17:29<br>Subject: Stop thousands of evictions<br>To: katherine@racefound.org.uk<br><br>[image: Shelter] <http://email.shelter.org.uk/c/11xGXLbyfaw1uPI8eXujllEP><br><br>*Don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt miss this chance to end revenge evictions, Kat.*<br><br>As a Shelter helpline adviser, I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve heard first-hand how something as<br>simple as reporting a broken shower or asking for a washing machine can<br>lead to eviction and even homelessness. [...] Kat Clayton 2014-11-18T16:45:14+00:00 2014-11-18T16:45:14+00:00 Tenancies Reform Bill- Shelter campaign to stop revenge evictions. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;56697217.1411 *Shelter campaign to stop revenge evictions.*<br><br>*What is revenge eviction?*<br>There is currently no protection from eviction for renters who report poor<br>conditions to their landlord or local authority. As a result, over 200,000<br>renters have been evicted or served notice in the past year because they<br>complained to their local council or their landlord about a problem in<br>their home... Apologies if you<br>receive this more than once.<br><br>- Tackling health inequalities in private rented housing<br><http://raceequalityfoundation.org.uk/training/events/tackling-health-inequalities-private-rented-housing>,<br><br>26 November 2014, London<br><br>- *NEW!<br><http://raceequalityfoundation.org.uk/training/events/better-health-and-social-care-black-and-minority-ethnic-communities>*<br>Better health and social care for black and minority ethnic communities<br><http://raceequalityfoundation.org.uk/training/events/better-health-and-social-care-black-and-minority-ethnic-communities><br>10 December 2014, Bradford / 16 December 2014, London / 15 January 2015<br>(TBC) Bristol<br><br>Tackling health inequalities in private rented housing<br><http://raceequalityfoundation.org.uk/training/events/tackling-health-inequalities-private-rented-housing><br>26 November 2014, London [...] Kat Clayton 2014-10-31T16:00:49+00:00 2014-10-31T16:00:49+00:00 Fwd: CALL FOR EVIDENCE - Local government's response to an Ageing Society (14 November 2014) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;5a317a50.1410 Apologies if you receive this more than once.<br><br>I've been asked to forward on this message- please reply directly to the<br>CPA with any questions/responses.<br><br>Kat<br><br>The Centre for Policy on Ageing, on behalf of the Local Government<br>Association (LGA), is making a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdcall for evidence\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd on the strategies that<br>Local Authorities need to adopt to accommodate an increasingly ageing<br>population. University of Leicester<br>Luciana Berger, MP. Shadow Minister for Public Health, UK. [...] Kat Clayton 2014-10-27T16:45:58+00:00 2014-10-27T16:45:58+00:00 Tackling health inequalities in private rented housing, 26th November 2014, London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;d5929719.1410 *Apologies if you receive this email more than once*<br><br>*Tackling health inequalities in private rented housing<br><http://www.raceequalityfoundation.org.uk/training/events/tackling-health-inequalities-private-rented-housing>*<br>26th November 2014, London<br>http://www.raceequalityfoundation.org.uk/training/events/tackling-health-inequalities-private-rented-housing<br><br>This event will bring together community, voluntary and public sector<br>action on private rented housing. It will identify and seek solutions to<br>health inequalities that affect private tenants, and their underlying<br>causes.<br><br>Nine million people now live in private rented housing. It is the fastest<br>growing housing sector in the UK and more people now live in private rented<br>housing than social housing. In London it is estimated to become the<br>largest housing sector by 2025, and nationally [...] Tom Moore 2014-10-21T16:52:34+01:00 2014-10-21T16:52:34+01:00 CFP: Deconstructing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGeneration Rent\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: Young People\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Housing Options and Future Welfare https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;7471e627.1410 With apologies for cross-posting, list members may be interested in either<br>attending or presenting at this seminar. We welcome a range of disciplinary<br>perspectives on the broad theme of young people's housing options and<br>future welfare.<br><br>*CFP: Deconstructing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGeneration Rent\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: Young People\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Housing Options and<br>Future Welfare*<br><br>Friday 13th February 2015<br><br>Venue: ICOSS Building, University of Sheffield [...] Tom Moore 2014-10-06T09:15:39+01:00 2014-10-06T09:15:39+01:00 CFP: Housing Studies Association Conference 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;5885d468.1410 List members may be interested in the new call for papers for the<br>interdisciplinary Housing Studies Association Conference, held in York on<br>8-10 April 2015. Apologies for cross-posting.<br><br>*Call for Papers: Housing Studies Association Conference 2015*<br><br>*Housing the Generations: Justice, Inequality and the Implications of<br>Political Change*<br><br>*University of York*<br><br>*Wednesday 8th \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Friday 10th April 2015* [...] Kat Clayton 2014-09-25T15:33:58+01:00 2014-09-25T15:33:58+01:00 New event: Tackling health inequalities in private rented housing https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;2ee86f3.1409 *Tackling health inequalities in private rented housing<br><http://www.raceequalityfoundation.org.uk/training/events/tackling-health-inequalities-private-rented-housing>*<br>26th November 2014, London<br>http://www.raceequalityfoundation.org.uk/training/events/tackling-health-inequalities-private-rented-housing<br><br>This event will bring together community, voluntary and public sector<br>action on private rented housing. It will identify and seek solutions to<br>health inequalities that affect private tenants, and their underlying<br>causes.<br><br>Nine million people now live in private rented housing. It is the fastest<br>growing housing sector in the UK and more people now live in private rented<br>housing than social housing. In London it is estimated to become the<br>largest housing sector by 2025, and nationally 20.8% of renters are<br>families with children. A third [...] Kat Clayton 2014-09-02T16:08:55+01:00 2014-09-02T16:08:55+01:00 Fwd: FW: Call for Evidence: Preventing Homelessness to Improve Health and Wellbeing https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;841d2b74.1409 Dear all<br><br>*CALL FOR EVIDENCE: PREVENTING HOMELESSNESS TO IMPROVE HEALTH & WELLBEING *<br><br>Public Health England (PHE) has commissioned Homeless Link to conduct a<br>rapid review of effective homelessness prevention interventions that have<br>been developed in response to identified health and wellbeing needs.<br><br>Preventing ill-health and reducing inequalities are key priorities for PHE.<br>It is also concerned with the wider determinants of health, of which<br>housing is one. There is a clear relationship between someone\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds housing or<br>homelessness situation and their health. [...] Kat Clayton 2014-07-09T12:22:06+01:00 2014-07-09T12:22:06+01:00 Fwd: UKHF P.I.E Briefing 09/07/2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;cfd0e854.1407 Members of the list may wish to complete this survey.<br><br>Kat<br><br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: UK Health Forum <emma.hughes@ukhealthforum.org.uk><br>Date: 9 July 2014 12:16<br>Subject: UKHF P.I.E Briefing 09/07/2014<br>To: Kat <katherine@racefound.org.uk><br><br>The latest from the Prevention Information & Evidence eLibrary<br><http://ukhealthforum.us2.list-manage1.com/track/click?u=d35da320da9c3ba890fa153f6&id=843c834be4&e=c01467ffbd><br>Is this email not displaying correctly?<br>View it in your browser<br><http://us2.campaign-archive1.com/?u=d35da320da9c3ba890fa153f6&id=9be6e41785&e=c01467ffbd>.<br><br>[image: UK Health Forum]<br><http://ukhealthforum.us2.list-manage.com/track/click?u=d35da320da9c3ba890fa153f6&id=094e029bc5&e=c01467ffbd><br>09/07/2014<br><br>*Welcome to the Prevention Information and Evidence briefing! This is a<br>weekly service of the latest news and resources added to our new Prevention<br>Information and Evidence elibrary. Visit the elibrary now to discover more<br>resources in your topic [...] Kat Clayton 2014-05-20T10:40:06+01:00 2014-05-20T10:40:06+01:00 Fwd: Information about conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;ba8f2e42.1405 ---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: Sue Westwood <s.westwood@keele.ac.uk><br>Date: 19 May 2014 18:38<br>Subject: Information about conference<br>To: ECHRN@jiscmail.ac.uk<br><br>You might be interested in "'Bona Latties' (Good Housing): National Older<br>LGBT Housing Network Conference" London. Organised by Stonewall Housing.<br>Open to all: http://bit.ly/1jiZNDZ<br><br>--<br>Kat Clayton<br><br>Information Officer<br><br>Race Equality Foundation<br><br>42-50 Worsley St<br><br>Manchester<br><br>M15 4LD<br><br>Tel: 0161 220 1016<br><br>Email: katherine@racefound.org.uk<br><br>http://www.raceequalityfoundation.org.uk<br><br>Embed race equality into your every day work with our free-to-view resource<br>collections on Better Health and Better Housing [...] Kat Clayton 2014-04-28T15:12:40+01:00 2014-04-28T15:12:40+01:00 Call for authors: Better Housing https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;8795debe.1404 The Race Equality Foundation is a national charity which promotes race<br>equality and helps to overcome barriers by exploring discrimination and<br>disadvantage. We are currently commissioning evidence-based briefing<br>papers for Better Housing, a project which examines issues relating to race<br>equality, housing and welfare (www.better-housing.org.uk).<br><br>The papers are usually around 8 pages long (including bibliography), and<br>although they focus on a variety of different issues and ethnic groups,<br>overarching themes include: [...] Kat Clayton 2014-04-11T16:10:53+01:00 2014-04-11T16:10:53+01:00 Fwd: Housekeeping issue affecting Yahoo email subscribers only https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BETTER-HOUSING;36bc811f.1404 -----Original Message-----<br>To: OWNERS-ANNOUNCE@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: [OWNERS-ANNOUNCE] Issue affecting Yahoo email subscribers to lists<br><br>Yahoo have recently changed the security settings on their email servers<br>which is causing major issues with mailing list services across the world,<br>including JiscMail.<br><br>Yahoo have changed their security settings in a way that causes emails sent<br>through a mailing list service to be identified as junk-mail by email<br>providers that using certain security systems. This causes many email<br>providers including Google, Microsoft and Yahoo themselves, to reject any<br>list emails originating from a Yahoo account. These rejections, can in some<br>cases, cause subscribers to be [...]
